columns.text: The problem will require us to compute the sustainable growth rate of Hendrix Guitars, Inc.

### Let's first provide the given data in the problem.

* Profit Margin is 6.3%.
* Total Asset Turnover is 1.75.
* Total debt ratio is 0.35.
* The payout ratio is 30%.

## Requirement.

### Compute the sustainable growth rate.

### Compute the retention ratio.

The retention ratio is the retained earnings that are added to the equity balance. The problem is silent to the retained earnings and net income. Therefore, we will use the payout ratio to compute the retention ratio.

The formula and computation are as follows.

$$
\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Retention Ratio}&= 1 - \text{Payout Ratio}\\[15pt]

&= 1 - 0.30\\[15pt]

&= 0.70 \times 100\\[15pt]

&= \boxed{\textbf{70\%}}
\end{aligned}
$$


Therefore, the retention ratio is **70%**.

### Compute the total equity ratio.

The equity ratio is used to measure the number of leverage companies use.

The formula is as follows.

$$
\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Total Equity Ratio}&= 1 - \text{Total Debt Ratio}\\[15pt]

&= 1 - 0.35\\[15pt]

&= \boxed{\textbf{0.65}}
\end{aligned}
$$


Therefore, the total equity ratio is **0.65**.

### Compute the debt-equity ratio.

The debt-equity ratio is used to measure the company's financial leverage. It is calculated by dividing the total debt ratio by the total equity ratio.

The formula is as follows.

$$
\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Debt-Equity Ratio}&= \dfrac{\text{Total Debt Ratio}}{\text{Total Equity Ratio}}\\[15pt]

&= \dfrac{0.35}{0.65}\\[15pt]

&= 0.5385 \times 100\\[15pt]

&=\boxed{\textbf{53.85\%}}

\end{aligned}
$$


Therefore, the debt-equity ratio is **53.85%**.

### Compute the return on equity.

The return on equity measures how the stockholders fared during the year.


The formula and calculation are as follows.

$$
\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Return on Equity}&= \text{Profit Margin} \times \text{Total Asset Turnover} \times \text{Equity Multiplier}\\[15pt]

&= 6.3\% \times 1.75 \times {(1 + \text{Debt-Equity Ratio)}}\\[15pt]

&= 6.3\% \times 1.75 \times \text{(1+53.85\%)}\\[15pt]

&= 6.3\% \times 1.75 \times 1.5385\\[15pt]

&= 0.1696 \times 100\\[15pt]

&= \boxed{\textbf{16.96\%}}
\end{aligned}
$$


Therefore, the return on equity is **16.96%**.

### Compute the sustainable growth rate.

Now that the retention ratio and return on equity are available, we can compute the sustainable growth rate.

$$
\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Sustainable Growth Rate}&= \dfrac{\text{ROE $\times$ b}}{\text{1 - ROE $\times$ b}}\\[15pt]
&= \dfrac{16.96\% \times 70\%}{1 - 16.96\% \times 70\%}\\[15pt]
&= \dfrac{0.1187}{1 - 0.1187}\\[15pt]
&= \dfrac{0.1187}{0.8813}\\[15pt]
&= 0.1347 \times 100\\[15pt]
&= \boxed{\textbf{13.47\%}}
\end{aligned}
$$

Therefore, the sustainable growth rate is **13.47%**.
In this exercise, we are to determine the sustainable growth rate.

## Sustainable Growth Rate
\
The sustainable growth rate is referred to as the maximum rate of growth attainable by the company without the need for external equity financing and at the same time, maintaining the debt-to-equity at a constant ratio.

The sustainable growth rate is the maximum rate of growth that a company would attain which requires the firm not to increase the company equity. While the ROE is the ratio of the net income and the equity.
\
Therefore, the sustainable growth rate is directly proportional to the ROE indicating that as the ROE increases, the sustainable growth rate increases and as the ROE decreases, the sustainable growth rate decreases as well.

## Profit Margin
\
Profit margin is the ratio to which the company generates profit from its revenue.
\
Profit margin is considered as a determinant of growth since an increase in this ratio will consequently increase the company's ability to generate profit that is used to fund the internal operations of the firm, thus increasing the sustainable growth of the company.
\
The profit margin is computed as follows:
 
$$\text{Profit Margin}=\frac{\text{Net Income}}{\text{Sales}}$$

## Total Asset Turnover
\
Investors may use this metric to see how well a company uses its resources to generate revenue.
\
An increase in the asset turnover ratio indicates an increase in the sales of the company. Consequently, this decreases the need for additional assets. Therefore, increasing asset turnover increases the sustainable growth rate of the company.

## Equity Multiplier
\
The equity multiplier is referred to as the ratio of the assets that are financed by the company's equity.

## Accounting Return on Equity
\
Accounting Return on Equity is referred to as the financial measure of the company's financial performance. The ROE is computed by dividing the net income of the company by the total equity.

Based on the given below, we can now use the computed amounts to determine the return on equity using the DuPont Equation of Profit Margin, Asset Turnover, and Equity Multiplier.
 
<center>

|Given||
|:--|--:|
|Profit Margin|6.3\%|
|Total Asset Turnover|1.75|
|Total Debt Ratio|0.35

To compute the Equity Multiplier:

$$\text{Equity Multiplier}=\frac{\text{Assets}}{\text{Total Equity}}$$

Since the total equity is not given, the following formula is used:

$$\text{Equity Multiplier}=\text{Debt-to-Equity Ratio}+1$$

To compute the equity multiplier:
 

$$\begin{aligned} \text{Equity Multiplier}
&=\text{Debt-to-Equity Ratio}+1\\[12pt] &={0.35}+1\\[12pt] &=\boxed{1.35}\\ 
\end{aligned}$$

 
**The equity multiplier is 1.35.**

## Retention Ratio
\
The retention ratio is referred to as the rate of the net income that is included in the retained earnings and is used to grow the business.

Now, let us compute the retention ratio:
<center>

|Given||
|:--|--:|
|Dividend Payout Ratio|30\%|
 
$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Retention Ratio}&=\text{1}-\text{Dividend Payout Ratio}\\[12pt]
&={1}-{30\%}\\[12pt]
&=\boxed{70\%}\\
\end{aligned}$$
 
**The retention ratio is 70\%.**

Now, let us compute the sustainable growth rate:
 
$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Sustainable Growth Rate}&=\frac{\text{ROE} \times b}{1-\text{ROE}\times b}\times 100\\[12pt]
&=\frac{0.1488\times 70\%}{1-0.1488\times 70\%}\times 100\\[12pt]
&=\frac{0.1042}{1-0.1042}\times 100\\[12pt]
&=\frac{0.1042}{0.8958}\times 100\\[12pt]
&={0.1163}\times 100\\[12pt]
&=\boxed{11.63\%}\\
\end{aligned}$$
Where:
ROE= Return on Equity
*b*= Retention Ratio

 
**The sustainable growth rate of the company is 11.63\%.**
